title: How Apple is organised for consistent Innovation? [HBR revisited]
author: Tanmay Borde
summary: Innovating once is an achievement, but consistently innovating is a different challenge altogether. It requires embedding innovation into the very fabric of an organisation, ensuring that creativity and forward-thinking are part of the companyâ€™s DNA. This is the key difference that sets Apple apart from its competitors, read more to find out how.
